parameters.name: AlpnEnabled
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to enable Application-Layer Protocol Negotiation (ALPN). Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false** (default)

parameters.name: AlpnPolicy
parameters.description:
The ALPN policy.

Valid values:

*   HTTP1Only
*   HTTP2Only
*   HTTP2Preferred
*   HTTP2Optional

parameters.name: CaCertificateIds
parameters.description:
The certificate authority (CA) certificates. This parameter takes effect only for listeners that use SSL over TCP.

> You can specify only one CA certificate.

parameters.name: CaEnabled
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to enable mutual authentication. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false** (default)

parameters.name: CertificateIds
parameters.description:
The server certificates. This parameter takes effect only for listeners that use SSL over TCP.

> You can specify only one server certificate.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description:
The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request.

You can use the client to generate the token, but you must make sure that the token is unique among different requests. The client token can contain only ASCII characters.

> If you do not specify this parameter, the system automatically uses the **request ID** as the **client token**. The **request ID** may be different for each request.

parameters.name: Cps
parameters.description: The maximum number of connections that can be created per second on the NLB instance. Valid values: **0** to **1000000**. **0** specifies that the number of connections is unlimited.

parameters.name: DryRun
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to perform only a dry run without performing the actual request. Valid values:

*   **true**: performs only a dry run. The system checks the request for potential issues, including missing parameter values, incorrect request syntax, and service limits. If the request fails the dry run, an error message is returned. If the request passes the dry run, the `DryRunOperation` error code is returned.
*   **false**(default): performs a dry run and performs the actual request. If the request passes the dry run, a 2xx HTTP status code is returned and the operation is performed.

parameters.name: EndPort
parameters.description:
The last port in the listener port range. Valid values: **0** to **65535**. The number of the last port must be greater than the number of the first port.

> This parameter is required when **ListenerPort** is set to **0**.

parameters.name: IdleTimeout
parameters.description: The timeout period of idle connections. Unit: seconds. Valid values: **1** to **900**. Default value: **900**.

parameters.name: ListenerDescription
parameters.description:
The name of the listener.

The name must be 2 to 256 characters in length, and can contain letters, digits, commas (,), periods (.), semicolons (;), forward slashes (/), at signs (@), underscores (\_), and hyphens (-).

parameters.name: ListenerPort
parameters.description:
The listener port. Valid values: **0** to **65535**.

If you set the value to **0**, the listener listens by port range. If you set the value to **0**, you must specify **StartPort** and **EndPort**.

parameters.name: ListenerProtocol
parameters.description: The listener protocol. Valid values: **TCP**, **UDP**, and **TCPSSL**.

parameters.name: LoadBalancerId
parameters.description: The ID of the Network Load Balancer (NLB) instance.

parameters.name: Mss
parameters.description:
The maximum size of a TCP segment. Unit: bytes. Valid values: **0** to **1500**. **0** specifies that the maximum segment size remains unchanged.

> This parameter is supported only by TCP listeners and listeners that use SSL over TCP.

parameters.name: ProxyProtocolEnabled
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to use the Proxy protocol to pass client IP addresses to backend servers. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false** (default)

parameters.name: ProxyProtocolV2Config
parameters.description: Specifies that the Proxy protocol passes the VpcId, PrivateLinkEpId, and PrivateLinkEpsId parameters to backend servers.

parameters.name: RegionId
parameters.description:
The region ID of the NLB instance.

You can call the [DescribeRegions](~~443657~~) operation to query the most recent region list.

parameters.name: SecSensorEnabled
parameters.description:
Specifies whether to enable fine-grained monitoring. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false** (default)

parameters.name: SecurityPolicyId
parameters.description:
The security policy ID. System security policies and custom security policies are supported.

Valid values: **tls_cipher_policy\_1\_0** (default), **tls_cipher_policy\_1\_1**, **tls_cipher_policy\_1\_2**, **tls_cipher_policy\_1\_2\_strict**, and **tls_cipher_policy\_1\_2\_strict_with\_1\_3**.

> This parameter takes effect only for listeners that use SSL over TCP.

parameters.name: ServerGroupId
parameters.description: The server group ID.

parameters.name: StartPort
parameters.description:
The first port in the listener port range. Valid values: **0** to **65535**.

> This parameter is required when **ListenerPort** is set to **0**.

parameters.name: Tag
parameters.description: The tags.
